title: Natural-Gas Prices Fall on Supply Worries
text:
The price of natural gas fell on Wednesday, underscoring investors’ concerns about a supply glut even as weather forecasts pointed to cooler temperatures for parts of the country.

Natural-gas futures fell 1.5% to $2.303 per million British thermal units after rising as much as 1.9% earlier in the day amid predictions that lower temperatures would soon hit the Midwest and Northeast. Demand for natural gas tends to climb when people use their heaters in the winter and air conditioners in the summer, so changes in the weather...
description: Investors worried about a supply glut even as weather forecasts pointed to cooler temperatures for parts of the country.
